plain: Based on the user's favourite books, it can be inferred that the user enjoys reading fiction novels. The user's favourite genre is likely to be women's fiction, as both "She's Come Undone" and "White Oleander" fall under this category. The user's favourite kind of plot is likely to be character-driven, as both novels focus on the protagonist's journey and personal development. The user's favourite setting is likely to be contemporary, as both novels are set in modern times. The user's favourite writing style is likely to be descriptive and emotive, as both novels use vivid language to convey the characters' emotions and experiences. The user's favourite length is likely to be novel-length, as both books are full-length novels. The user's favourite topic is likely to be related to personal growth and self-discovery, as both novels explore these themes in depth. The user's favourite pacing is likely to be slow and steady, as both novels take the time to develop the characters and their stories. The user's favourite narrative structure is likely to be third-person omniscient, as both novels use this perspective to provide a broad view of the characters and their world. The user's favourite themes are likely to be related to self-acceptance, overcoming trauma, and the importance of family and community.
